contextId.information: Both of these phrases have the same meaning and are repeated to emphasize how God's reign is forever. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
contextId.quote: His kingdom is ... generation to generation

contextId.information: These phrases are parallel and they mean the same thing. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
These two phrases describe how Daniel was feeling. The second one gives more information about the first one, explaining about his grieved spirit. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
contextId.quote: my spirit was grieved inside of me ... the visions I saw in my mind troubled me

contextId.information: These two phrases express one idea in two different ways for emphasis. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
contextId.quote: We have sinned and have done what is wrong

contextId.information: These two clauses mean basically the same thing and are used together to emphasize how bad sin is. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
contextId.quote: still we sinned; we have done wicked things
